english: What are your plans for the weekend?
gujlish: Taro weekend mate shu plan chhe?

english: Maybe I’ll watch a movie or hang out with friends. What about you?
gujlish: Shaayad movie jovu hoy ke mitro saathe bahar javanu. Tare?

english: I’m thinking of visiting that new cafe downtown.

english: Sounds good! Let’s plan something together.
gujlish: Saru chhe! Chalo saathe koi plan kariye.

english: Are you free on Saturday evening?
gujlish: Tare Saturday evening free chhe?

english: Yes, Saturday works perfectly for me.
gujlish: Haan, Saturday mara mate perfect chhe.

english: Great! Should we try that new pizza place?
gujlish: Maja! Navo pizza place try kariye?

english: Yes, I heard their cheese burst is amazing!
gujlish: Haan, tema cheese burst bahu maja ni chhe!

english: What time should we meet on Saturday?
gujlish: Saturday ketli vaar malishu?

english: How about 7 pm?
gujlish: 7 vage chale?

english: Perfect! I’ll see you there.
gujlish: Perfect! Tame jova madi jaisu.

english: By the way, have you seen the weather forecast for the weekend?
gujlish: Are, weekend mate weather forecast jovu?

english: Looks like it’s going to rain, so don’t forget your umbrella.
gujlish: Lage chhe varsad thase, umbrella lai javu.

english: Thanks for the heads up! I’ll keep it ready.
gujlish: Thanks! Hu ready rakhis.

gujlish: Shaayad family saathe lunch. Tare?

english: I might just relax at home and catch up on some reading.

english: That sounds nice. Sometimes a quiet day is needed.

english: Absolutely! After a busy week, rest is important.
gujlish: Bilkul! Vaydo pachi aaram jaruri chhe.

english: We should decide the best time to visit Goa to avoid the heavy monsoon.

gujlish: Aaje Delhi no traffic totally pagal hatu!

english: Why are there so many cars on the road?
gujlish: Road upar etli badhi car kem che?

english: The traffic in Delhi is always a nightmare during office hours.
gujlish: Delhi ma office time par traffic hamesha nightmare hoy chhe.

english: Even Google Maps gives up on Delhi traffic sometimes.

english: Why is there always construction going on in Delhi?
gujlish: Delhi ma construction toh hamesha chalu kem hoy chhe?

gujlish: 30 minute thi same autos ane cars jova male chhe aaju baju.

english: People don't follow lane discipline at all.

english: The horns never stop, it gives me a headache.

english: Rickshaws just stop anywhere they want.

english: Bikes keep zigzagging through the traffic.

english: Why are there so many VIP movements every day?

english: Metro is better than being stuck in traffic for hours.

english: The traffic makes me want to cancel all my plans.

english: You can watch an entire movie while stuck in Delhi traffic.
gujlish: Delhi na traffic ma atkai ne ek movie puri jova male chhe.

english: Some days it feels like the whole city is on the road.
gujlish: Kahi divso toh lage ke akhu shaher j road par chhe.

english: I waste more time in traffic than at work.
gujlish: Traffic ma time vagadva ma kaam karta vadhare time jai chhe.

english: My legs go numb sitting in one place for hours.
gujlish: Ek j jagya par ghanta sudhi besi ne pag sun thai jai chhe.

english: Every signal feels like a mini-vacation—unwanted and long.
gujlish: Darek signal mini vacation jevo lage chhe—na joyelo ane lambo.

english: Even Google Maps gives up during peak hours.

english: The honking is worse than an alarm clock in the morning.
gujlish: Savare ni alarm karta pan vadhu irritating toh honking chhe.

english: Auto drivers just squeeze in like it’s a race.

english: Can’t even listen to music peacefully while driving.
gujlish: Driving karta karta shanti thi music pan sambhli na shakai.

english: By the time I reach home, I’m mentally exhausted.

english: Why does everyone decide to drive at the same time?
gujlish: Badha loko same time par drive karva kem nikale chhe?

english: It’s not traffic anymore, it’s a daily jam ritual.

english: Even two kilometers take half an hour now.
gujlish: Atyare toh be kilometer pan aadho kalak lai le chhe.

english: There’s construction everywhere adding to the chaos.
gujlish: Jya joyo tya construction, ane traffic ma vadhu gado.

english: Why are traffic lights so badly timed here?
gujlish: Ahiya na traffic lights etla kharab time kem kare chhe?

english: It’s like a puzzle every day figuring out the best route.
gujlish: Roj ek puzzle jevu lage ke kayu rasto best hase.

english: No matter what shortcut I take, it’s always jammed.
gujlish: Kayu pan shortcut levi, hamesha jam hoy j chhe.

english: Sometimes I think walking would be faster.
gujlish: Kahi vaar toh lage ke chaliye toh vadhu j fast hase.

english: I’ve started carrying snacks because who knows how long I’ll be stuck.

english: Every morning commute feels like a survival challenge.

english: I think I spend more on petrol than groceries now.
gujlish: Atyare toh petrol ma vadhu paisa kharchai chhe groceries karta.

english: Traffic doesn't move, even at midnight sometimes.
gujlish: Kahi vaar toh madhyaratri ma pan traffic halto nathi.

english: It’s impossible to be on time in this city.

english: We prepare a special welcome board for guests at the entrance.
gujlish: Darvaje par mehmano mate khas welcome board banaviye chhe.

english: We buy eco-friendly plates and cups for serving snacks and drinks.
gujlish: Snacks ane drinks serve karva mate eco-friendly plate ane cup kharidye chhe.

english: We clean the kitchen thoroughly to prepare for festive cooking.
gujlish: Tyohar mate rasoighar ne sari rite saf kariye chhe.

english: We make arrangements for parking space for visiting relatives.
gujlish: Aavta rishtedaro mate parking ni vyavastha kariye chhe.

english: We prepare a list of emergency contacts for safety during celebrations.
gujlish: Utsav doraan suraksha mate emergency contact ni list banaviye chhe.

english: We arrange for special lighting on the staircase and hallway.
gujlish: Sidi ane hallway par khas light lagadvani vyavastha kariye chhe.

english: We prepare a variety of dry fruits and nuts for guests.
gujlish: Mehmano mate vivid dry fruit ane nut banaviye chhe.

english: We decorate the walls with handmade Diwali crafts.
gujlish: Deewaro par haaththi banela Diwali craft thi sajavat kariye chhe.

english: We ensure all electrical appliances are working properly before Diwali.
gujlish: Diwali pela badha electrical appliance sari rite chalu hoy te joiye chhe.

english: We prepare a schedule for lighting diyas and candles after sunset.
gujlish: Surya ast thai gaya pachi diya ane mombatti jalavva ni yojna banaviye chhe.

english: We arrange for extra seating with cushions and mats in the living room.
gujlish: Living room ma vadhu bethak mate cushion ane mat ni vyavastha kariye chhe.

english: We decorate the garden area with fairy lights and lanterns.
gujlish: Bagiche ne fairy light ane lantern thi sajavyu chhe.

english: We prepare a to-do list for cleaning and decoration activities.
gujlish: Safai ane sajavat na kam mate to-do list banaviye chhe.

english: We buy new slippers and footwear for family members for Diwali.
gujlish: Family member mate Diwali par pehervana nava juta kharidye chhe.

english: We set reminders for buying fresh flowers every morning during Diwali.
gujlish: Diwali doraan pratidin taza phool kharidva mate reminder rakhiye chhe.

english: We organize a donation drive for the needy before Diwali.
gujlish: Diwali pela jaruri loko mate donation drive kariye chhe.

english: We prepare special herbal teas and drinks for guests.
gujlish: Mehmano mate khas herbal tea ane drinks banaviye chhe.

english: We practice singing devotional songs to perform during puja.
gujlish: Pooja doraan gaayva mate bhajan ni practice kariye chhe.

english: We plan to watch Diwali-themed movies with the family.
gujlish: Parivar sathe Diwali theme vado movie joye ni yojna chhe.

english: We prepare a fire safety kit including water and sand buckets.
gujlish: Aag ni suraksha mate pani ane ret na baltiyo sathe fire safety kit banaviye chhe.

english: We arrange for waste segregation bins for plastic and biodegradable waste.
gujlish: Plastic ane biodegradable kachra mate alag dabbo ni vyavastha kariye chhe.

english: We prepare a list of phone numbers of all family members for coordination.
gujlish: Samanvay mate badha family member na phone number ni list banaviye chhe.

english: We make arrangements to protect pets from loud firecrackers.
gujlish: Vadhu shor karta patakha thi pets ne surakshit rakhva vyavastha kariye chhe.

english: We buy fresh flowers to make garlands for the pooja altar.
gujlish: Pooja mandap mate garland banava taza phool kharidye chhe.

english: We prepare traditional snacks like chakli and namak para in advance.
gujlish: Pehla thi chakli ane namak para jeva traditional snacks banaviye chhe.

english: We clean the water tanks and ensure supply is uninterrupted during festivities.
gujlish: Water tank ne saf kari ne utsav doraan pani ni supply chalti rahe te joiye.

english: We decorate the porch with colorful lanterns and lights.
gujlish: Porch ne rangin lantern ane light thi sajavyu chhe.

english: We plan to perform Lakshmi puja early in the morning on Diwali day.
gujlish: Diwali divas ni savar Lakshmi puja karva ni yojna chhe.

english: We prepare a basket of dry fruits and sweets as gifts for neighbors.
gujlish: Padosio mate dry fruit ane mithai no gift basket banaviye chhe.

english: We check all switches and wiring before decorating with lights.
gujlish: Lights lagadvani pela badha switch ane wiring ni jach kariye chhe.

english: We prepare colorful rangoli designs using natural powders.
gujlish: Natural powder thi rangin rangoli design banaviye chhe.

english: We buy firecrackers that produce less smoke to protect the environment.
gujlish: Vataavarni raksha mate ochu dhuan karta patakha kharidye chhe.

english: We prepare a special meal plan including vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes.
gujlish: Shakahari ane mansahari vyanjan sathe khas bhojan yojna banaviye chhe.

gujlish: Pooja mate badha peetal ane tamba na bartano saf kari ne polish kariye chhe.

english: We decorate the pooja altar with lights and fresh flowers.
gujlish: Pooja mandap ne light ane taza phool thi sajavyu chhe.

english: We prepare special invitations for Diwali parties and events.
gujlish: Diwali party ane event mate khas invitation banaviye chhe.

english: We arrange for musical instruments and setup for Diwali bhajans.
gujlish: Diwali bhajan mate musical instrument ane setup ni vyavastha kariye chhe.

english: We buy new candles and decorative diyas for the celebrations.
gujlish: Utsav mate navi mombatti ane sajavat na diya kharidye chhe.

english: We prepare a photo album to capture and preserve Diwali memories.
gujlish: Diwali ni yaadon mate photo album banaviye chhe.

english: We ensure all balconies and windows are decorated with lights and flowers.
gujlish: Balcony ane khidkiyo ne light ane phool thi sajavyu chhe.

english: We clean and decorate the garage or parking area for visitors.
gujlish: Mehmano mate garage ke parking area saf ane sajavyu chhe.

english: We prepare a list of important rituals and their timings for Diwali day.
gujlish: Diwali divas na mukhya ritual ane te na samay ni list banaviye chhe.

english: We arrange a kids’ corner with toys and activities during the celebrations.
gujlish: Utsav doraan balako mate khelona ane activity sathe kids’ corner banaviye chhe.

english: We prepare a thank-you speech for the family gathering after Diwali.
gujlish: Diwali pachi family gathering mate thank you speech taiyar kariye chhe.

english: We stock extra fuel and candles in case of power cuts during Diwali night.
gujlish: Diwali ni raat bijli jova na hoy to extra tel ane mombatti rakhie chhe.

english: We prepare fresh garlands to welcome Goddess Lakshmi on Diwali night.
gujlish: Diwali ni raat Lakshmi mata nu swagat karva taza mala banaviye chhe.

topic: Debating street food vs. restaurant food
english: Do you actually prefer street food over restaurants?
gujlish: Tane sachoche street food restaurants karta vadhu game che?

gujlish: Street food ni maja to restaurant ma kya male!

gujlish: Law Garden ni pav bhaji ne koi restaurant match kari shake nai!

gujlish: Yeh heavenly chaat mate thodu risk toh chalse!

topic: Debating street food vs. restaurant food
english: Restaurant food is consistent, though.

topic: Debating street food vs. restaurant food
english: You just like the thrill of tummy troubles!

english: No problem! How’s your diet going?
gujlish: Koi vaat nathi! Tamaru diet kem chhe?

english: Trying to cut down on sugar.
gujlish: Sugar ochhu karva prayatna kari rahi chu.

english: Good move! Sugar is the sneaky enemy.
gujlish: Saras! Sugar sneaky enemy chhe.

english: What’s your cheat meal?
gujlish: Tamaru cheat meal shu chhe?

english: Pizza, hands down!
gujlish: Pizza, koi doubt nathi!

english: Same here, pizza lover gang!
gujlish: Same here, pizza lover group!

english: We should have a cheat day together.
gujlish: Ek divas cheat day saath manavi joiye.

english: Deal! Guilt-free pizza feast.
gujlish: Deal! Guilt-free pizza khavanu maja aavse.

english: Haha, best motivation to stay on track.
gujlish: Haha, best motivation chhe.

english: Ever injured yourself while working out?
gujlish: Workout karta injury thai chhe?

english: Once, twisted my ankle. Took a week off.
gujlish: Ek vaar ankle twist thai gayu, ek hafta rest lidho.

english: Ouch! That must’ve hurt a lot.
gujlish: Ouch! Khub dard thayo hase.

english: Yeah, but rest helped a lot.
gujlish: Haan, rest thi farak padi gayo.

english: Do you warm up before workouts?
gujlish: Workout pehla warm-up karo cho?

english: Always! Prevents injuries.
gujlish: Hamesha! Injury thava thi rokay chhe.

english: What’s your favorite warm-up routine?
gujlish: Tamaru favorite warm-up shu chhe?

english: Jump rope and some dynamic stretches.
gujlish: Jump rope ane dynamic stretches karu chu.

english: Nice! I prefer light jogging.
gujlish: Saras! Hu light jogging karu chu.

english: Cardio or weights, what do you prefer?
gujlish: Cardio ke weights, shu game chhe?

english: Weights mostly, to build strength.
gujlish: Weights game chhe, strength mate.

english: I love cardio for endurance.
gujlish: Hu cardio game chu endurance mate.

english: Do you do any yoga?
gujlish: Tame yoga pan karo cho?

english: Yes, yoga keeps me flexible and calm.
gujlish: Haan, yoga thi flexibility ane calm male chhe.

english: I should start yoga too!
gujlish: Mane pan yoga start karvu joiye!

english: You won’t regret it, trust me.
gujlish: Tame regret nahi karso, trust karo.

english: Let’s swap workout tips sometime.
gujlish: Koi vaar workout tips exchange kariye.

english: Absolutely, learning is fun!
gujlish: Bilkul, learning maja ni chhe.

english: Have you ever done a fitness challenge?
gujlish: Tame fitness challenge try karyo chhe?

english: Yes, 30-day plank challenge last year.
gujlish: Haan, last year 30 divas plank challenge karyu.

english: How was it? Tough or fun?
gujlish: Kem hatu? Tough ke fun?

english: Both! I felt stronger after it.
gujlish: Dono! Tyanthi strong lage chhu.

english: That’s inspiring, I want to try it too.
gujlish: Inspiring chhe, hu pan try karvu chu.

english: Let me know when you start, I’ll join you!
gujlish: Jare start karo, mane kahjo, hu saathe join thais.

english: What’s your go-to post-workout meal?
gujlish: Workout pachi tamaru favourite meal shu chhe?

english: Protein shake with banana always does the trick.
gujlish: Protein shake ane banana hamesha best chhe.

english: Nice! I usually go for paneer and veggies.
gujlish: Saras! Hu to paneer ane veggies khavu chu.

english: Do you stretch after your workouts?
gujlish: Workout pachi stretch karo cho?

english: Always, helps muscle recovery.
gujlish: Hamesha, muscles ne recover karva madad kare chhe.

english: What’s your favorite stretch?
gujlish: Tamaru favorite stretch shu chhe?

english: Hamstring stretch, it really relaxes me.
gujlish: Hamstring stretch, mane khub relax kare chhe.

english: Do you ever get gym anxiety?
gujlish: Tame kadach gym ma anxious feel karo cho?

english: Sometimes, especially when gym is crowded.
gujlish: Koi vaar, jem jare gym crowded hoy.

english: I feel you, but pushing through helps.
gujlish: Samji sakun chu, pan push karvu important chhe.

english: Do you prefer morning or evening workouts?
gujlish: Tame morning ke evening workout prefer karo cho?

english: Morning for sure, feels refreshing.
gujlish: Morning chhe, refresh feel thay chhe.

english: Evenings are good for me, less rush.
gujlish: Mane to evenings game chhe, gym ma kam rush hoy chhe.

english: Have you tried intermittent fasting?
gujlish: Tame intermittent fasting try karyu chhe?

english: Yes, it helped me shed fat faster.
gujlish: Haan, thi fat ochhu thayo.

english: I’m curious but a bit scared to try.
gujlish: Hu curious chu pan thodu dar lage chhe.

english: Start slow, it’s manageable.
gujlish: Dheere dheere start karo, easy chhe.

english: Do you take supplements?
gujlish: Tame supplements lecho?

english: Just protein and multivitamins.
gujlish: Protein ane multivitamins levu chu.

english: Good choices, natural is best.
gujlish: Saras choice, natural best chhe.

english: How do you handle rest days?
gujlish: Rest days kem manage karo cho?

english: I relax and do light stretching.
gujlish: Relax thai ne light stretching karu chu.

english: Me too, rest is recovery time.
gujlish: Hu pan, rest recovery mate chhe.

english: What’s your gym playlist like?
gujlish: Tamaru gym playlist kem chhe?

english: Mostly upbeat pop and some EDM.
gujlish: Mostly upbeat pop ane EDM.

english: EDM pumps me up for sure.
gujlish: EDM mane pump kare chhe.

english: Do you track your progress?
gujlish: Tame progress track karo cho?

english: Yes, weekly weigh-ins and photos.
gujlish: Haan, weekly weigh-ins ane photos.

english: Photos are motivating to see change.
gujlish: Photos thi change dekhavi ne motivation male chhe.

english: Do you prefer solo workouts or a gym buddy?
gujlish: Tame solo workout karo ke gym buddy saathe?

english: Gym buddy makes it more fun.
gujlish: Gym buddy thi maja avi jay chhe.

english: True, they keep you accountable.
gujlish: Sachu, accountability male chhe.

english: What’s your favorite muscle group to train?
gujlish: Tamaru favorite muscle group shu chhe?

english: Chest and arms for me.
gujlish: Chest ane arms game chhe.

english: I like working on legs, feels powerful.
gujlish: Hu legs game chu, power feel thay chhe.

english: Do you follow a workout routine or freestyle?
gujlish: Workout routine follow karo ke freestyle?

english: Routine mostly, for consistency.
gujlish: Routine chalu chhe, consistency mate.

english: Sometimes I freestyle when energy is high.
gujlish: Koi vaar freestyle pan karto chu.

english: How do you stay motivated on tough days?
gujlish: Tough divas ma motivation kem male?

english: I remind myself of my goals.
gujlish: Goals yaad kari ne push karu chu.

english: Good mindset, bro!
gujlish: Saras mindset chhe, bro!

english: Thanks! What about you?
gujlish: Thanks! Tame kem?

english: I watch motivational videos sometimes.
gujlish: Koi vaar motivational videos joye chu.

english: Those really boost the energy.
gujlish: Te energy ne boost kare chhe.

english: Have you tried any group classes?
gujlish: Tame group classes try karyi chhe?

english: Yes, Zumba and spinning, so fun!
gujlish: Haan, Zumba ane spinning maja ni chhe.

english: I want to join Zumba next time.
gujlish: Hu next time Zumba join karvu chhu.

english: Let’s go together!
gujlish: Chalo saathe jaiye!

english: Sounds like a plan, bro!
gujlish: Saras plan chhe, bro!

english: Alright, time to hit the gym again tomorrow.
gujlish: Chalo, kal fer thi gym jaiye.

english: How do you stay hydrated during intense workouts?
gujlish: Intense workout doraan tame kem hydrated raho cho?

english: I carry a big water bottle and sip often.
gujlish: Maro mota water bottle hoy ane baar baar piyu chu.

english: Ever tried coconut water post workout?
gujlish: Workout pachi coconut water try karyu chhe?

english: Yes, it’s super refreshing and full of electrolytes.
gujlish: Haan, khub refreshing ane electrolytes thi bharpur.

english: What’s your favorite cardio exercise?
gujlish: Tamaru favorite cardio exercise shu chhe?

english: Running on the treadmill, keeps my heart pumping.
gujlish: Treadmill upar daudvu, heart ne pump kare chhe.

english: I prefer cycling, feels less boring.
gujlish: Hu cycling game chu, boring pan nathi.

english: Do you track calories burned?
gujlish: Calories burned track karo cho?

english: Yeah, using a fitness app on my phone.
gujlish: Haan, phone ni fitness app thi.

english: Apps make it easier to stay on track.
gujlish: Apps thi tracking easy thai jaye chhe.

english: Ever had any injuries while training?
gujlish: Training doraan injury thayi chhe?

english: Once sprained my ankle during running.
gujlish: Ek vaar running doraan ankle sprain thayu.

english: That sounds painful! How long did it take to recover?
gujlish: Kharaab hatu! Ketlo time recovery ma lagyu?

english: About a month, had to rest completely.
gujlish: Ek mahino, total rest levu padu.

english: Do you warm up before every session?
gujlish: Tame pratyek session pehla warm up karo cho?

english: Always, it prevents injuries and boosts performance.
gujlish: Hamesha, injuries rokva ane performance vadhaadva.

english: What’s your warm-up routine like?
gujlish: Tamaru warm-up routine kem chhe?

english: Light jogging followed by dynamic stretches.
gujlish: Light jogging ane dynamic stretches.

english: Do you track your sleep to improve recovery?
gujlish: Recovery mate sleep track karo cho?

english: Yes, at least 7-8 hours every night.
gujlish: Haan, roj 7-8 kalak.

english: Sleep is the ultimate muscle builder.
gujlish: Sleep best muscle builder chhe.

english: Ever tried yoga as a recovery tool?
gujlish: Recovery mate yoga try karyu chhe?

english: Yes, it helps with flexibility and relaxation.
gujlish: Haan, flexibility ane relaxation ma madad kare chhe.

english: I should try yoga sometime, sounds beneficial.
gujlish: Mane pan yoga try karvu joiye.

english: What’s your gym attire like?
gujlish: Tamaru gym outfit kem chhe?

english: Comfortable tees and shorts mostly.
gujlish: Comfortable tees ane shorts.

english: I prefer tank tops for better movement.
gujlish: Hu tank tops game chu, movement mate.

english: Do you use any gym gadgets or tech?
gujlish: Tame gym ma koi gadgets vapro cho?

english: Smartwatch and wireless earbuds.
gujlish: Smartwatch ane wireless earbuds.

english: Those keep me motivated and track progress.
gujlish: Te motivation aape chhe ane progress track kare chhe.

english: Ever tried a personal trainer?
gujlish: Personal trainer try karyo chhe?

english: Once for a month, helped improve my form.
gujlish: Ek mahina mate, form improve thayu.

english: Form is everything to avoid injuries.
gujlish: Form important chhe injury nathi thava mate.

english: Do you prefer free weights or machines?
gujlish: Free weights ke machines game chhe?

english: Free weights, because they engage more muscles.
gujlish: Free weights, vadhu muscles engaged thaye.

english: Machines are good for beginners though.
gujlish: Machines beginners mate saras chhe.

english: How often do you change your workout routine?
gujlish: Workout routine ketli vaar change karo cho.

english: Every 4-6 weeks to avoid plateaus.
gujlish: Pratyek 4-6 hafta ma change karu chu.

english: Nice, keeps the body guessing!
gujlish: Saras, body ne guess karavta rakhe chhe!

english: Do you listen to podcasts while working out?
gujlish: Workout doraan podcasts sambhlo cho?

english: Sometimes! Fitness or motivation ones.
gujlish: Koi vaar! Fitness ke motivation wala.

english: Do you feel confident after gym?
gujlish: Gym pachi confidence feel karo cho?

english: Absolutely! Feels like I can conquer the world.
gujlish: Bilkul! Duniya jeeti saku evi feeling ave.

english: Same here, gym is a therapy for me.
gujlish: Same! Gym mara mate ek therapy chhe.

english: What time do you usually hit the gym?
gujlish: Tame kya time gym jao cho mostly?

english: Early mornings, the vibe is unmatched.
gujlish: Savare savare, vibe alagaj hoy chhe.

english: I go post-college, helps me de-stress.
gujlish: College pachi jau chu, stress release thaye chhe.

english: Night workouts have a different peace.
gujlish: Raat na workouts ni shanti alagaj hoy chhe.

english: True! As long as we stay consistent.
gujlish: Sachu! Consistent rahiye etle kaam thay chhe.

english: Consistency is the king of gains.
gujlish: Consistency j gain no raja chhe.

english: Do you ever feel like skipping the gym?
gujlish: Kyaarey gym skip karva nu mann thay chhe?

english: Sometimes, but then I remind myself why I started.
gujlish: Koi vaar, pan pachhi mane yaad ave ke shaa mate sharu karyu.

english: That’s the spirit! Discipline beats motivation.
gujlish: Ae j josh! Discipline motivation karta powerful chhe.

english: What’s your go-to protein source?
gujlish: Tamaru favourite protein source shu chhe?

english: Soya chunks and protein shakes mostly.
gujlish: Mostly soya chunks ane protein shake.

english: I add paneer and tofu for variety.
gujlish: Hu variety mate paneer ane tofu pan add karu chu.

english: You meal prep your diet?
gujlish: Tame diet mate meal prep karo cho?

english: Every Sunday, I plan my whole week.
gujlish: Roj Sunday, pura hafta ni planning karu chu.

english: That’s smart! Less decisions, more discipline.
gujlish: Saras chhe! Ocha decisions, vadhare discipline.

english: What motivates you to stay fit?
gujlish: Tane fit rahva mate motivation shu chhe?

english: To be my best version every day.
gujlish: Roj mara best version banva mate.

english: Ever inspired someone to start working out?
gujlish: Koi ne inspire karyo chhe workout sharu karva?

english: Yes! My cousin joined after seeing my progress.
gujlish: Haan! Mara progress joyine mara cousin join karyo.

english: You’re a walking motivation, man!
gujlish: Tame toh chalta motivation chho re bhai!

english: Thanks! It feels great to lift others up too.
gujlish: Thank you! Bija ne upar uthavavu pan bhan sarkhu lage chhe.

english: Ever participated in any fitness challenges?
gujlish: Koi fitness challenge ma bhag lidho chhe?

english: Yes, a 30-day plank challenge!
gujlish: Haan, 30 divas no plank challenge lidho.

english: Plank is pure pain but pure gains!
gujlish: Plank to pain chhe pan gain pan!

english: How do you balance college and gym?
gujlish: College ane gym kem balance karo cho?

english: Early mornings are my secret weapon.
gujlish: Savarna gym j mara secret weapon chhe.

english: Discipline early morning means control whole day.
gujlish: Savarna discipline etle pura divas par control.

english: Ever felt like gym is your second home?
gujlish: Gym biju ghar lage chhe kyaarey?

english: Every single day bro, my comfort zone.
gujlish: Roj bro, gym j comfort zone chhe.

english: Best conversations happen over dumbbells!
gujlish: Best vaat to dumbbells vachche thaye chhe!

english: Do you believe in fitness soulmates?
gujlish: Tane fitness soulmate upar belief chhe?

english: Maybe you’re mine, gym partner forever?
gujlish: Shayad tu j che, gym partner forever?

english: Haha I’ll spot you, you lift me.
gujlish: Haha hu tane spot karu, tu mane lift kar!

english: Deal! Together we rise, together we rep.
gujlish: Deal! Bane male ucha chhiye, rep karie joye!

english: Our fitness bond stronger than protein powder.
gujlish: Aapdu fitness bond toh protein karta pan strong!

english: We don’t skip leg day or feelings.
gujlish: Leg day na feelings, banne skip na karie!

english: Real strength is lifting each other.
gujlish: Khari strength etle ek bijane lift karvu.

english: You make cardio feel like a dance.
gujlish: Tane joye toh cardio pan dance lage!

english: Only because you’re my rhythm.
gujlish: Karank tu j to mari rhythm chhe.

english: Let’s stay fit and flirty forever!
gujlish: Fit ane flirty, always together!

english: Here’s to forever reps and rest days.
gujlish: Cheers to infinite reps ane chill rest days!

english: Our love language? Supersets and stretches.
gujlish: Love language? Supersets ane stretches j chhe!

english: Gym crush turned gym love!
gujlish: Gym crush thi gym love sudhi!

english: Let’s keep flexing and flirting.
gujlish: Flex pan karie, flirt pan karie!

english: I’ll never ghost you on leg day.
gujlish: Leg day ma hu toh pakka avish!

english: And I’ll always be your spotter in life.
gujlish: Ane hu toh hamesha tari life ni spotter rehish!

english: Cheers to dumbbells and deep convos!
gujlish: Cheers to dumbbells ane deep vaat!

english: Muscles grow, so does our bond.
gujlish: Muscle vade chhe, aapdu bond pan!

english: We’re gym goals, no cap.
gujlish: Aapde toh gym goals chhiye boss!

english: Fit together, forever together.
gujlish: Fit pan saath, forever pan saath!

english: Lift heavy, love harder.
gujlish: Weight pan motu, love pan khub!

english: You’re the pump in my heart.
gujlish: Tuj j chhe mane heart pump karave!

english: Without you, gym is just weights.
gujlish: Tane vina, gym toh blank lage!

english: Together, we’re the perfect workout mix.
gujlish: Aapde banne, ek perfect workout combo chhiye!

english: You’re my favorite gym session.
gujlish: Tame j maara favourite gym session chho!

english: From gym partners to life partners?
gujlish: Gym partner thi life partner banie?

english: Hey, have you noticed how suddenly it got chilly?
gujlish: Oye, tune to dekha ke achanak thandi kem thai gayi?

english: Yes, yesterday it was hot, but today I had to wear a sweater.
gujlish: Haa yaar, kal sudhi to garmi hati, aaje to sweater pehervu padi gaya.

english: This kind of weather always makes me want to stay in bed.
gujlish: Aa mausam thay te mane bed ma rehva man kare chhe.

english: Same here, a warm cup of tea sounds perfect right now.
gujlish: Mane pan, garam chai no glass khub perfect lage chhe aa vakhte.

english: Did you hear the rain last night? It was amazing.
gujlish: Tune kal raat ni varsad ni awaaz suni? Ekdam maja avi gayi.

english: Yes! I love how rain smells after it stops.
gujlish: Haa! Varsad pachhi mitti ni gandh to kamaal lage chhe.

english: Do you like the cool breeze during this season?
gujlish: Tane aa mausam ma thandi hawa game chhe ke nahi?

english: I love it, it feels so fresh and relaxing.
gujlish: Mane khub game chhe, ekdam fresh ane relaxed feel thay chhe.

english: Sometimes, the fog in the morning makes everything look magical.
gujlish: Savare je dhund thai chhe, te badhu ekdam magical lage chhe.

english: True! It feels like the whole city is in a dream.
gujlish: Sachi vaat chhe! Puray city ek sapna j lagti hoy.

english: But sometimes, the cold wind can be too much.
gujlish: Pan kai vakhat thandi hawa thodu vadhu lagti hoy chhe.

english: Yeah, that’s why I always carry my jacket.
gujlish: Haa, ae mate to hu hammesha jacket lai ne jaun chhu.

english: I’m glad the sun is out today; it’s not too cold now.
gujlish: Aaje suraj chhe, te vadhu thandu nahi lagey.

english: Yes, the sun makes a big difference in this weather.
gujlish: Haa, suraj thi mausam bahu farak pade chhe.

english: I wish it would rain again soon.
gujlish: Mane pan ichchha chhe ke jaldi varsad ave.

english: Same here, the rain makes everything so fresh.
gujlish: Mane pan, varsad thi badhu navi navi lage chhe.

english: Do you like walking in the rain?
gujlish: Tane varsad ma walk karvu game chhe?

english: Yes, but only if I have an umbrella.
gujlish: Haa, pan umbrella hoy to j.

english: I prefer sitting inside and watching the rain.
gujlish: Hu to ghar ni andar bai ne varsad joyu gamu chhu.

english: That sounds cozy! I love those moments.
gujlish: Wow, khub cozy lage chhe! Mane pan game chhe ae moments.

english: Sometimes, the temperature drops so fast it surprises me.
gujlish: Kai vakhat temperature etlu jaldi ochhu thai jai ke surprise thai jai.

english: Exactly! Like one moment it’s hot, and the next it’s freezing.
gujlish: Bilkul! Ek minute to garmi lage ane bijo minute thandi.

english: That’s why I love layering my clothes.
gujlish: Ae mate mane layering karvu game chhe.

english: Same here, layers keep me comfortable all day.
gujlish: Mane pan layers sathe din bhar comfortable rehvu game chhe.

english: Have you noticed how the leaves change color this season?
gujlish: Tane dekha ke a mausam ma patta kem rang badle chhe?

english: Yes, it looks so beautiful, like nature’s own art.
gujlish: Haa, khub sundar lage chhe, prakruti ni art j.

english: I love this time of year, it feels very peaceful.
gujlish: Mane aa time khub game chhe, ekdam shant ane peaceful lage chhe.

english: Me too, it’s perfect for long evening walks.
gujlish: Mane pan, long evening walk mate perfect chhe aa mausam.

english: Have you started preparing for the colder nights?
gujlish: Tame cold night mate tayari kari?

english: Yes, I bought a new blanket and some warm socks.
gujlish: Haa, navi kambal ane garam socks pan lai liya.

english: Good idea! I still need to get a heater.
gujlish: Saras vichar! Mane heater lai levu chhe aj sudhi.

english: Be careful though, heaters can make the air dry.
gujlish: Pan heater vaparva ma dhyan rakhi, hawa sukhi thai jai chhe.

english: Thanks for the tip! I’ll keep a humidifier handy.
gujlish: Tip mate thanks! Hu humidifier pan lai rakhis.

english: I noticed the mornings are getting foggier too.
gujlish: Mane pan lagyu chhe ke savar no fog vadhi gayo chhe.

english: Yes, it makes driving a bit challenging sometimes.
gujlish: Haa, kai vakhat driving thodi tricky thai jai chhe fog thi.

english: I always take extra care while driving in fog.
gujlish: Hu pan fog ma drive karta extra cautious rahu chhu.

english: Good, safety first!
gujlish: Saru chhe, safety first j hoy.

english: Do you feel like the days are getting shorter too?
gujlish: Tane pan lage chhe ke divaso ochha thaya chhe?

english: Yes, it gets dark earlier and earlier.
gujlish: Haa, rat jaldi andharo thai jai chhe.

english: I miss the long summer evenings already.
gujlish: Mane to long summer evenings ni vadhu yaad aave chhe.

english: Me too, those evenings were perfect for hanging out.
gujlish: Mane pan, ae evenings toh perfect hatu mazedar time mate.

english: Maybe we should plan some indoor activities now.
gujlish: Shayad aaje thi indoor activities plan karva joiye.

english: That’s a good idea! Movie marathons or board games?
gujlish: Saras vichar! Movie marathon ke board game khele?

english: I’m up for both, depends on mood.
gujlish: Mane banne game chhe, mood pr depend kare chhe.

english: We could also bake some cookies together.
gujlish: Saath ma cookie banaviye pan, maja aavi jase.

english: Yummy! I love baking, especially in cold weather.
gujlish: Mmm, mane baking game chhe, khas kari ne thandi mausam ma.

english: Perfect, we have the plan then!
gujlish: Perfect, to plan taiyar chhe.

english: By the way, did you hear about the forecast for next week?
gujlish: Ane sunyu chhe ke agalna hafta ma mausam change thase?

english: Yes, they said it might get even colder.
gujlish: Haa, kahi rahya chhe ke vadhu thandu padi sakay chhe.

english: Better get our woolens ready then.
gujlish: To woolens ready karva joiye to.

english: Do you think this winter will be harsher than last year?
gujlish: Tane lage chhe ke aavti winter pichhli varshi karta vadhu kathin hase?

english: Maybe, the forecast did mention some cold waves.
gujlish: Shayad, forecast ma to cold wave ni vaat hati.

english: I hope it won’t be too cold; I hate shivering all day.
gujlish: Mane to asha chhe ke vadhu thandu na pade, din bhar thandi thandi lagti hoy to problem thai jai.

english: Haha, same yaar. I prefer cozy warmth anytime.
gujlish: Haha, mane pan game chhe garam garam feel.

english: Do you miss summer at all?
gujlish: Tane summer no thodu yaad aave chhe ke nahi?

english: Sometimes, especially for the long days and mangoes!
gujlish: Kai vakhat yaad aave chhe, khas kari ne lamba divas ane mango mate.

english: Haha, mangoes are the best part of summer!
gujlish: Haha, mango to summer ni jaan chhe!

english: But I don’t miss sweating all day.

english: Deal! You have the best taste in movies anyway.
gujlish: Deal! Tamara movie taste ekdam best chhe.

english: Haha, just wait until you see my playlist.
gujlish: Haha, wait karo tame jova mate playlist.

english: I’m already curious and excited!
gujlish: Hu to already curious ane excited chu!

english: Guess we’ll have to plan a lot of winter hangouts.
gujlish: Lage chhe winter ma ghana hangouts plan karva padse.

english: And I’m totally up for that. Winter’s gonna be fun!
gujlish: Hu pan ready chu. Winter maja no hase!

english: Promise me one thing?
gujlish: Ek vaat promise karso?

english: Anything for you.
gujlish: Tame mate to badhu.

english: Promise you won’t ever let the winter chill keep us apart.
gujlish: Promise karjo ke winter chill aapde alag na kare.

english: Never! We’ll keep each other warm no matter what.
gujlish: Kabhi nahi! Aapde ek bijane hamesha warm rakhsu.

english: I’m glad to hear that. You’re my favorite winter person now.
gujlish: Saru lagyu! Tame mara favorite winter person banya chho.

english: And you’re mine. Looks like we’re made for each other this season.
gujlish: Ane tame pan mara. Lage chhe aa season aapde mate chhe.

english: Winter magic is real, I swear!
gujlish: Winter magic real chhe, manva pade.

english: Especially when shared with someone special.
gujlish: Jare koi special sathe share karo to.

english: You just made my heart warmer than the weather outside.
gujlish: Tame to mara heart ne bahar ni weather karta vadhu warm karavi didhu.

english: That’s because you deserve all the warmth and more.
gujlish: Karan ke tame badhi warmth ane vadhu deserve karo cho.

english: I think this winter is going to be unforgettable.
gujlish: Lage chhe aa winter bhuli na sake eva hase.

english: Because of you, it already is.
gujlish: Tame hoy to ekdam.

english: Let’s make a promise to create many more memories together.
gujlish: Promise karie vadhu yaado banavva mate sathe.
Hu 100% ready chu.

english: Alright, my winter partner in crime.
gujlish: Toh mara winter partner in crime.

english: Love that! Crime with you sounds much more fun.
gujlish: Maja avi! Tame sathe crime maja no lage.

english: Shall we start with a snowball fight next time?
gujlish: Next time snowball fight thi start kariye?

english: Absolutely! I’m so ready to lose (or win) against you.
gujlish: Bilkul! Hu ready chu tamara khilaf jeetva (ke harva) mate.

english: Challenge accepted. Prepare to get drenched!
gujlish: Challenge accepted. Taiyar raho bhegva mate!

english: I hope you’re good at running away then!
gujlish: Tame to chhuto jova capable hovo joie!

english: Haha, you underestimate me.
gujlish: Haha, tame mane underestimate karo cho.

english: I never do, especially not with you.
gujlish: Hu kadach nahi karto, khas karine tamara sathe.

english: Then I’m looking forward to a fun winter full of surprises.
gujlish: To hu joyu chu maja ni winter mate je surprise bhari hase.

english: Same here! Winter never felt this good before.
gujlish: Mane pan! Winter aavi rite maja no kabhi nathi lagyu.

english: Winter nights are the best when spent with someone special.
gujlish: Winter ni ratone best lage chhe jare koi special sathe hoy.

english: Especially when that someone brings endless laughter.
gujlish: Khas karine jare te koi end na laughter lyave.

english: You do know how to make my cold days warm and bright.
gujlish: Tame to jan cho kem mara cold divaso ne warm ane bright banaavi devu.

english: Only because you let me in your heart’s cozy corner.
gujlish: Karan ke tame mane tamara heart na cozy corner ma lai gaya cho.

english: That’s the sweetest thing anyone’s said to me this winter.
gujlish: Aa winter ma badha thi sweet vaat je koi kahe.

english: Then it’s official, we’re winter besties now!
gujlish: Toh official chhe, aapde winter besties bani gaya.

english: Besties with a hint of magic and maybe a little romance.
gujlish: Besties jevu pan thoda magic ane thoda romance sathe.

english: Romance makes winter even more magical, no doubt.
gujlish: Romance thi winter ekdam magical bane chhe, doubt nai.

english: So, how about a midnight walk under the stars?
gujlish: Toh, midnight walk karie ke tara thaki niche?

english: Only if you promise to hold my hand tight.
gujlish: Bas promise karjo ke tight hath pakadishu.

english: Deal. Can’t wait to steal glances and smiles with you.
gujlish: Deal. Tame sathe glances ane smiles steal karva joye chhe.

english: Haha, you’re too smooth with these lines.
gujlish: Haha, tame to lines ma ekdam smooth chho.

weather_change_0_313.english: Smoothness is just for you, nothing less.
weather_change_0_313.gujlish: Smoothness to tamara matej chhe, biju nahi.

english: Aww, now you’re making me blush in this chilly weather.
gujlish: Aww, hu to aa thandi weather ma blush karu chhu.

english: Blush suits you. It’s like your own little warmth glow.
gujlish: Blush tame game chhe, tamaru little warmth glow j chhe.

english: You always know how to notice the little things.
gujlish: Tame hamesha little things ne notice karto rehjo.

english: Because it’s the little things that make big moments special.
gujlish: Karan ke little things thi j big moments special bane chhe.

english: Exactly! Like this chilly chat turning into a warm memory.
gujlish: Saru! Aa thandi vaat ek warm memory ma badli gayi.

english: I hope every winter from now on has moments like this.
gujlish: Aasha chhe ke aavi vaat har winter ma hoy.

english: With you, I’m sure it will.
gujlish: Tame hoy to pakka hase.

english: Let’s promise to make the best of every cold day.
gujlish: Promise kariye ke badha cold divas ma maja karisu.

english: Promise accepted with a big smile.
gujlish: Promise accepted ek mota smile sathe.

english: Smile suits you more than any winter jacket ever could.
gujlish: Smile tame par best lage chhe winter jacket karta pan.

english: Aww, you’re making me feel special every second.
gujlish: Aww, tame mane khas feel karavi rahya chho har second.

english: That’s what you deserve, nothing less.
gujlish: Tame deserve karo chho, biju kuch nahi.

english: You’re my sunshine on this chilly day.
gujlish: Aa thandi divas ma tame mara sunshine chho.

english: And you’re my warm cozy blanket.
gujlish: Ane tame mara warm cozy blanket.

english: Looks like we’re the perfect winter combo.
gujlish: Lage chhe aapde perfect winter combo chhiye.

english: Winter just got way better because of you.
gujlish: Winter tamara karane ekdam better ban gayo.

english: And you’re the reason I look forward to every chilly morning.
gujlish: Ane tame chho jethi hu badha thanda savaro no wait karu chu.

english: We should start planning our winter adventures right away.
gujlish: Aapde winter adventures no plan turant karvu joiye.

english: Agreed! Let’s make a bucket list.
gujlish: Agree! Bucket list banaviye.

english: First on the list: more chai and long talks.
gujlish: Pehlu item: vadhu chai ane lamba vaat che.

english: Second: cozy fireside stories.
gujlish: Biju: cozy fireside stories.

english: Third: star gazing nights with you.
gujlish: Triju: tame sathe star gazing ni raat.

english: Fourth: snowy day adventures and laughter.
gujlish: Chothu: snowy divas ni maja ane laughter.

english: And last but not least, warm hugs to end the day.
gujlish: Last ma, garam hugs divas ne perfect end mate.

english: Sounds like the perfect winter to me.
gujlish: evu lage chhe ke perfect winter chhe.

english: With you, every season becomes perfect.
gujlish: Tame sathe to badha seasons perfect bane chhe.

english: Let’s never let this vibe fade.
gujlish: Aa vibe kadach fade na thay tevu kariye.

english: Not a chance. This fire will keep burning.
gujlish: Chance j nathi. Aa fire toh always burn thase.

english: Together, we’re unstoppable—even by the cold!
gujlish: Aapde sathe chhiye toh cold pan rok nai shake.

english: Let’s keep warming each other’s hearts.
gujlish: Ek bijana hearts warm karta rahie.

english: And building cozy memories we’ll never forget.
gujlish: Ane cozy yaado banavta rahie je kadach bhuliye nahi.

english: To winters full of magic, masti, and us!
gujlish: Winter je magic, masti ane aapda thi bharela hoy!

english: Cheers to that!
gujlish: Tena mate cheers!

english: Let’s never stop making winter this wonderful.
gujlish: Winter ne avi rite wonderful banavvu kadach bandh na kariye.

english: We’ve got a season full of memories to create.
gujlish: Aapdi paase memories banava mate ek full season chhe.

english: Let’s make every snowflake count.
gujlish: Badha snowflakes ne memorable banavie.

english: And every moment warmer than the last.
gujlish: Ane badho moment pichhla karta vadhu warm hoy.

english: Did you see Rishi’s grand entry at the wedding?
gujlish: Tane Rishi ni wedding entry joi ke nahi?

english: Yes! It was totally filmy!
gujlish: Haan re! Ekdum full filmi entry hati!

english: He came on a horse like a king.
gujlish: Ghoda par avi gayo, ekdum king jemo.

english: The bride looked so shocked.
gujlish: Bride toh proper shocked thai gayi.

english: Honestly, I didn’t expect that much drama.
gujlish: Sach kahu toh etlu drama toh expect nathi karyu hatu.

english: Same here! But it was super fun.
gujlish: Same! Pan maja toh avi gayi.

english: How did Riya look as the bride?
gujlish: Tane Riya kem laagi? Bride tariqe?

english: She looked like a fairy, honestly.
gujlish: Riya toh ekdum fairy jemi laagtihati.

english: But I think you’d have looked better in that dress.
gujlish: Pan mane lage ke tya outfit ma tane joi ne vadhu sari laagat.

english: Oh really? Do you compare every bride?
gujlish: Oh really? Tame badha brides ne compare karo chho?

english: No no, you're a special case.
gujlish: Na na, tame special case chho.

english: You give compliments like butter on paratha.
gujlish: Tame toh ekdam butter jema compliment apo chho.

english: Honestly, without seeing you, the wedding felt incomplete.
gujlish: Pan sach kahu toh, tamne joya vagar wedding complete nathi lagyu.

english: Aww, so you came just to see me?
gujlish: Aww, etle mane jova wedding ma avya?

english: You were half the reason, honestly.
gujlish: Half reason toh tame j.

english: And the other half?
gujlish: Baaki half?

english: The free food and the dance floor, of course.
gujlish: Free food ane dance floor.

english: Haha! You're brutally honest.
gujlish: Haha! Ekdum honest.

english: You looked like a total star on the dance floor.
gujlish: Tame dance ma toh full on star lagi raha hata.

english: I was dancing just to impress you.
gujlish: Hu toh dance karu chu ke tamne impress kari saku.

english: Then your mission was definitely successful!
gujlish: Mission complete thai gayo then!

english: I think you caught my hidden message.
gujlish: Mane lage che, tame maari line pakdi lidhi.

english: I’m a bit clever, you know. But I enjoyed it.
gujlish: Thodi clever chu. Pan maza avi.

english: By the way, what dish did you like the most?
gujlish: By the way, food ma kyu item best lagyu tamne?

english: The Undhiyu was on another level!
gujlish: Undhiyu toh next level hatu.

english: Yeah! I went back twice just for Undhiyu.
gujlish: Arey haan! Mane toh double round lidha undhiyu mate.

english: I still liked you more than the Undhiyu.
gujlish: Mane toh tame undhiyu karta vadhu cute lagya.

english: Aha, someone's in full flirting mode.
gujlish: Aha, tame flirting mode ma avi gaya.

english: Just a little, not full!
gujlish: Thodu thodu bas, full nahi.

english: So, where were you sitting during the wedding?
gujlish: Okay okay, toh tame kyaan bethela hata wedding time?

english: I didn’t get a chance, everyone was clicking photos.
gujlish: Mane samay madyo nahi, badha photo lavta hata.

english: Which pose was your favorite in your photos?
gujlish: Toh tamara photo ma kya pose best hatu?

english: The one where you were standing behind me. That made it perfect.
gujlish: Jya tame paachad ubha hata, etle automatically pose best thai gayo.

english: Flirting level is officially 200 now.
gujlish: Flirting level 200 chalu chhe.

english: You could stop me, you know!
gujlish: Tame stop karo toh karo!

english: Why would I? I'm enjoying it!
gujlish: Mane toh maja avi rahi chhe, kem stop karu?

english: Okay fine, keep going. Did you post any photos?
gujlish: Fine, chalu rakho. Pan tame photo post kari?

english: Yes, and I wrote ‘Best view at the wedding’ as the caption.
gujlish: Haan, caption ma lakhyu 'Best view in the wedding'.

english: Was that caption meant for me?
gujlish: Caption tame maate hato?

english: Who else could it be for?
gujlish: Tama si vadhare best view bijo kone hovu?

english: You're totally stealing my heart here.
gujlish: Tame toh dil le gaya yaar.

english: Your heart doesn’t belong anywhere else now.
gujlish: Mane joya vagar tamaru dil rehvu nathi.

english: You know that was kinda romantic, right?
gujlish: Lagyu ne romantic boline?

english: Yeah, I blushed a little!
gujlish: Haan, thodu blush kari lidhu.

english: Blushing looks really cute on you.
gujlish: Blush tamara face par vadhu cute lage che.

english: Do you carry a compliment store with you or what?
gujlish: Tame badha compliment store maathi lavya chho?

english: Nope, straight from the heart.
gujlish: Nahi, directly heart mathi.

english: Aww, you're such a movie character!
gujlish: Awwww. Tame toh full filmy chho.

english: Need the right co-star to be filmy.
gujlish: Filmy banavva tamara sath joiyu pade.

english: Then invite me. We’ll make a couple entry next time!
gujlish: Toh invite karo na, next wedding ma couple entry lavishu!

english: Did you get a bit emotional?
gujlish: Tu kai emotional thai gayo?

english: I really liked the rasmalai.
gujlish: Mane to rasmalai khub gamee.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Old songs have that timeless charm, you know?
gujlish: Old songs ma ek timeless charm hoy che, samjhai?

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Totally! New remixes are energetic but sometimes miss the soul.
gujlish: Bilkul! Nawa remixes energetic hoy che pan kai vakhat soul missing lage che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Exactly! Like my dad’s old playlist, pure gold.
gujlish: Sachu! Mara dad ni old playlist jevi, ekdum gold.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: But remixes make old songs fresh for the youth.
gujlish: Pan remixes old songs ne youth mate fresh banave che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: True, without remixes, many classics might get forgotten.
gujlish: Sachu, remix vagar ketlak classics bhuli jay.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Still, nothing beats that raw emotion in old songs.
gujlish: Pan old songs ma je raw emotion hoy te biju koi nathi.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Agreed. Sometimes remixes are just loud copies.
gujlish: Agree chu. Kai vakhat remix loud copy lage che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: But hey, some remixes actually add a cool twist.
gujlish: Pan kai remixes ma ek cool twist hoy che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Yeah, like that DJ mixing old beats with new sounds.
gujlish: Haa, je DJ old beats ne new sounds sathe mix kare.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: It’s like respecting the past while embracing the present.
gujlish: Pachhal nu respect karvu ane present ne embrace karvu.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Exactly! But some people just prefer originals only.
gujlish: Sachu! Pan kai loko original songs j game che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: I get it, originals have that nostalgic vibe.
gujlish: Samjhu chu, original songs ma nostalgic vibe hoy che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: True that. Do you have any favorite old song?
gujlish: Sachu. Tari koi favorite old song che?

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Of course! 'Lag Ja Gale' always hits the heart.
gujlish: Haa, 'Lag Ja Gale' hamesha dil ne chuoi de che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Classic! And your favorite remix?
gujlish: Classic! Ane tari favorite remix su che?

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: That remix of 'Tujhe Dekha To' is fire!
gujlish: Tujhe Dekha To no remix to pura fire che!

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Haha, same! Remix ne beat mast che.
gujlish: Haha, same! Remix ni beat ekdum mast che.

topic: Comparing old songs to new remixes
english: Sometimes I feel like remix is more about club vibes.
